column3: str

Regitt would enlist your aid in fighting a duel against drowsiness.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
Speak with Shigitt.
Deliver the requested item to the drowsy dwarf at the Hour of Certain Durance.
Report to Regitt.
Speak with Shigitt.

Report to Regitt.

With all the extra hours we've been working, it's become a struggle to stay focused. So I thought to myself, “a good gulp of strong dwarven ale'll perk me right up!”...only it seems to have had the opposite effect.
<yawn> As luck would have it, Ronitt's designed some special tool he claims can solve our drowsiness dilemma─we just need someone alert enough to put it together.
Do me a favor and talk to Shigitt before he passes out, will you? He'll have everything you need.
<yawn> ...Oh, I must have dozed off for a moment. Yes. Supplies. For Ronitt's grandly named “Unfailing Eye Opener.”
With your skills, forging a simplified shock prod shouldn't prove too much of a challenge. And even if it does, I've stocked the automaton over yonder with surplus materials.
With your skills, crafting a nice whippy coeurl o' nine tails shouldn't prove too much of a challenge. And even if it does, I've stocked the automaton over yonder with surplus materials.
With your skills, mixing up a batch of sinus-singeing pepper powder shouldn't prove too much of a challenge. And even if it does, I've stocked the automaton over yonder with surplus materials.
Once the “Unfailing Eye Opener” is ready, take it to a particularly sleepy lad gathering resources over by the Hour of Certain Durance. He's volunteered to be the first vict─uh, test subject.
<beep> Materials detected. Request denied.
<beep> Materials detected. Request denied.
<beep> Ingredients detected. Request denied.
<beep> Request for materials acknowledged.
<beep> Request for materials acknowledged.
<beep> Request for ingredients acknowledged.
Zzz... Buh? Lali─? Ho, is that the...whatchamacallit? The “Eye Opener”?
Hmmm. It looks a little more <Emphasis>unpleasant</Emphasis> than I'd expected. Still, I'll try anything to ward off this blasted sleepiness for a while.
So I just press this button here, and─ayayayayayaya!!! Id...id my fathe thuppothed to be thith numb!?
So I just flick this on my skin, and─owowowowowow!!! Bloody beardless bairns, that feels like a hundred bee stings all at once!
So I just flip open the pouch and breathe in nice and dee─eeeeeek! <cough> My nose! <splutter> My throat! <wheeze> My poor, tortured eyes!
(-Wide-awake Dwarf-)<pant> <pant> Well, that... That was an experience. You know, for some odd reason, I sort of want to try it again...
(-Wide-awake Dwarf-)I think I'm ready to get back to work now. You can tell Regitt I feel...awakened...in more ways than one.
Zzz... Huh? Who!? Me!? Asleep on my feet? Never! So, uh, how did the testing go?
...Wide awake, eh? “In more ways than one,” he said? I don't know what that means, but I might have to test it for myself. Good job, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>!
Normal-quality items crafted in the course of this quest serve no purpose and cannot be sold. It is recommended that you discard them.
